author: VNExplorer
title: 'It Feels Good To Be Back In Action': INS Vikrant Equipped With Guidance Radar, Surface To Air Missiles
text:
‘it feels good to be back in action’: ins vikrant equipped with guidance radar, surface to air missiles
New Delhi: India’s first indigenous aircraft carrier INS Vikrant now gets sophisticated guidance radar and surface-to-air missiles. The radars and missiles equipped on the aircraft carrier are – Multi-Function Surveillance, Track and Guidance Radar (MF-STAR) and Barak-8 Medium Range Surface to Air missiles (MRSAMs), reported NDTV.
Notably, Indian destroyers of the Kolkata and Visakhapatnam class are already equipped with the MF-STAR-MRSAM combo. The MF-STAR detects airborne targets, including aircraft and anti-ship missiles. Meanwhile, MR-SAM can shoot down a target at a distance of more than 80 km.
Images of aircraft and the MF-STAR-MRSAM combo are shared by the official account of INS Vikrant.
Images of INS Vikrant:
India’s second aircraft INS Vikrant was commissioned into the Indian Navy in September last year. INS Vikrant will be deployed on the eastern seaboard during Milan-2024, reported the media house.
The aircraft carrier weighing 45,000 tonnes was built at a cost of Rs 20,000 crore. The aircraft carrier is 262 metres long and 62 metres wide. The INS Vikrant can have 30 aircraft on board. The aircraft carrier was launched in August 2013. It was undocked on 10 June 2015 after the completion of structural work. It was delivered to the Indian Navy in July last year and commissioned into the force two months later.
Notably, India is also in negotiations for procuring 26 Rafale-M aircraft for the Indian Navy.

author: Olímpia Mairos
title: D. José Tolentino de Mendonça: “A Eucaristia é um lugar de portas abertas”
text: 01 jun, 2024 - 20:52 • [Olímpia Mairos](https://rr.sapo.pt/artigo/33803/olimpia-mairos) O cardeal D. José Tolentino Mendonça, enviado especial do Papa para o V Congresso Eucarístico Nacional, afirmou esta tarde, em Braga, que “a Eucaristia é um lugar de portas abertas, um lugar de inclusão”. “É uma mesa que não é de exclusão, mas é uma mesa da integração”, acrescentou, assinalando que o pontificado do Papa Francisco tem sido muito importante, “porque tem colocado em cima da mesa esse aspeto: a Eucaristia não pode ser um lugar de punição, mas tem de ser um lugar de encontro, onde as vidas saem reforçadas”. O prefeito do Dicastério para a Cultura e Educação da Santa Sé observou também que “a Eucaristia não aparece ligada ao mérito”, mas, é, sim, “o dom radical que Jesus faz de si mesmo pela vida do mundo”. “E aquele todos, todos, todos que o Papa Francisco incansavelmente repete é, sem dúvida, uma lição que em profundidade nós aprendemos na celebração da Eucaristia, que é o momento de arquitetura da comunidade”, acrescentou. Na conferência de imprensa, o delegado pontifício para o Congresso sublinhou ainda que “a eucaristia é um pão partido para um mundo novo” e que é a partir da Eucaristia, que os cristãos devem assumir “uma cultura que passa pelo compromisso concreto no mundo e por uma colaboração com os outros homens e mulheres na construção de uma história mais justa, mais fraterna, mais solidária”. “Hoje, num tempo de tantas polarizações, onde um vento de pessimismo percorre os corações, e onde a Europa se vê ameaçada, hoje já, por uma guerra que nos toca tão profundamente, tudo aquilo que a eucaristia representa é uma cultura de paz, é uma mensagem necessária num contexto divisivo, como é aquele que, infelizmente, hoje o mundo vive”, afirmou. O cardeal D. José Tolentino de Mendonça partilhou ainda com os jornalistas “a muita alegria” com que aceitou esta missão que o Papa Francisco lhe confiou, também para “testemunhar esta benevolência do Santo Padre para Portugal e a maneira como ele olha para o nosso país”. Questionado sobre o que espera encontrar, este domingo, no Sameiro, o cardeal Tolentino assumiu estar “curioso pelo olhar de Maria, que é aquele olhar que está à espera de todos”. “E esse encontro com Maria, no âmbito da espiritualidade Eucarística, será, sem dúvida, para todos um ponto focal muito importante”, apontou, a par da “redescoberta de uma espiritualidade eucarística, que é sempre aquela que coloca Jesus no centro e parte e reparte do Evangelho”. D. José Tolentino de Mendonça espera encontrar também uma espiritualidade samaritana de uma Igreja que se faz serviço, de proximidade, de compaixão, que, certamente, é mais pobre em recursos, mas é chamada a colaborar de uma forma humilde, aceitando que a Eucaristia se conta como um lava-pés, como lavar os pés da humanidade”.

author: Addison Perry
title: AI Transforming the Fall Protection Market for Growth
text: AI Transforming the Fall Protection Market for Growth [Addison Perry](https://investorshangout.com/profile/view?id=79055)Updated: 10-17-2024 05:54 PM Understanding the Future of the Fall Protection Market The global Fall Protection Market is on the brink of remarkable expansion. Current estimates suggest an impressive growth of around USD 5.05 million between 2024 and 2028. The projected compound annual growth rate (CAGR) during this time frame is nearly 15.42%. One of the driving forces behind this growth is the increasing emphasis on onsite training, particularly in emerging markets. Key Factors Influencing Market Growth The rapid development of the Fall Protection Market can be attributed to a variety of factors. Notably, industries are beginning to recognize the importance of investing in safety measures. Incorporating advanced training on safety protocols, specifically regarding fall protection measures, has become essential. Companies cannot overlook the considerable risks associated with workplace accidents, making it crucial for them to integrate reliable fall protection solutions. Current Landscape and Key Players Several prominent organizations are at the forefront, paving the way for advancements in safety measures. Renowned companies include 3M Co., Honeywell International Inc., MSA Safety Inc., and Werner Co., among others. These companies are committed to innovation and technology that not only improve safety but also enhance the user experience. Market Challenges and Opportunities Despite the promising growth, there are challenges to be confronted. The underdeveloped safety regulations in certain regions, particularly in emerging economies, can hinder market progress. For instance, inadequate awareness regarding the importance of fall protection solutions leads to underutilization. Countries with less stringent safety regulations often experience higher rates of workplace accidents, pointing to a critical need for better education and enforcement in these areas. Utilization of Smart Technologies AI is starting to define new trends within the Fall Protection Market. With smart technologies coming to the forefront, companies can enhance their safety protocols through real-time monitoring and data analysis. This innovative approach enables firms to address potential hazards proactively rather than reactively. The Role of Sustainability Modern consumers increasingly prioritize sustainability, impacting the way companies approach production and supply chain management. By incorporating sustainable practices into the fall protection equipment sector, organizations not only meet regulatory requirements but also align with consumer values. Sustainability is an essential consideration, influencing market dynamics significantly. Market Segmentation Insights A deep dive into market segmentation reveals interesting insights. The Fall Protection Market encompasses various segments, including products like safety harnesses and safety nets. This segmentation extends to diverse industries, including construction, oil and gas, and telecommunications. Each sector presents unique challenges and opportunities that companies must navigate to ensure effective service delivery. Importance of Compliance with Regulations Compliance with safety regulations is non-negotiable. Regulatory bodies establish strict guidelines for the inspection and quality of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE), emphasizing the need for rigorous safety checks. Ensuring adherence to these regulations not only minimizes risks but also helps companies maintain reputability in the industry. Strategic Recommendations Based on emerging trends and future opportunities, organizations are advised to invest in technology that enhances employee safety. Regular safety audits and the employment of advanced personal protective equipment are crucial. Moreover, exploring partnerships with technology providers can facilitate the incorporation of state-of-the-art solutions into existing systems. Frequently Asked Questions What is driving the growth of the Fall Protection Market? The growth is driven by increasing emphasis on worker safety and technological innovation. Which companies are leading the market? Leading companies include 3M Co., Honeywell International Inc., and MSA Safety Inc. What challenges does the market face? Challenges include inadequate safety regulations in some regions and lack of awareness. How is AI influencing the market? AI enhances monitoring, data analysis and improves the overall safety protocols. Why is compliance important in this market? Compliance ensures worker safety and helps maintain the credibility of organizations. author: Sajid Salamat
title: No ticket for deserters
text: Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) on Thursday condemned the “torture” and arrest of the party’s Vice Chairman Shah Mahmood Qureshi, calling on the Supreme Court to take a suo motu notice of the matter. The former ruling party maintains that Qureshi’s latest arrest was “illegal” as he had been bailed out by the apex court and the orders for his detention under the 3-MPO were also withdrawn soon after being issued. Speaking to media outside Adiala jail, where PTI founder Imran Khan has been incarcerated, Barrister Gohar Khan said “Shah Mahmood Qureshi was pushed and tortured yesterday”. Barrister Gohar said that PTI is being targeted for several months. Speaking about the ticketing of candidates, he said that the party is finalising the tickets and will reach a decision in a few days. Barrister Gohar also ruled out the possibility of giving tickets to “those who held press conferences” to announce their detachment from PTI, saying that the party was not considering such individuals. Nomination papers of all PTI leaders have been submitted, he added. He also expressed dissatisfaction over the Election Commission of Pakistan’s (ECP) performance and called on the body to ensure free and fair polls in the country. The ECP is all set to stage the much-awaited general elections across the country in less than two months. As per the polls schedule issued by the electoral body, scrutiny of the nomination papers will be carried out till the 30th of this month. Appeals against the acceptance or rejection of nomination papers can be submitted until January 3 and decisions on these appeals will be made by January 10. Talking about any possibility of forming an electoral alliance or supporting any other party, Barrister Gohar said that no decision has been made in this regard. “Sheikh Rashid has his own party. No decision has yet been made regarding an alliance with him,” he said referring to Awami Muslim League (AML) chief, who is PTI supremo’s close ally in politics. As the electioneering picks up pace with less than two months left in general elections, PTI complains about the absence of a “level playing field” for it to participate in the electoral process. “This caretaker setup is subjecting us to injustice,” Gohar said. He, however, added that PTI supremo Khan has reiterated the pledge to “fight till the last ball”. The PTI leader further stated the party wants Khan to contest in elections.

author: world today news
title: U.S. Genomics Market Set to Surpass $67 Billion by 2034: Unveiling the Future of Biotech Expansion
text:
AI Revolutionizes Genomics: U.S. Market Insights and future Trends Artificial intelligence is rapidly transforming the field of genomics within the United States,providing unprecedented capabilities for data analysis,personalized medicine,and drug discovery.The U.S.genomics market is experiencing substantial growth, fueled by advancements in next-generation sequencing (NGS) and its increasing applications in clinical diagnostics, cancer research, and studies of infectious diseases. Functional genomics currently dominates the market, while pathway analysis is projected to see the fastest growth from 2025 to 2034. This expansion is supported by investments in genomics-based solutions across pharmaceuticals,agritech,and synthetic biology.
Published: May 15, 2024
The Impact of Artificial Intelligence on Genomics Artificial intelligence is emerging as a transformative force in genomics, offering solutions to challenges that conventional methods struggle to overcome. AI algorithms can efficiently process vast genomic datasets, identifying patterns and mutations that might otherwise be missed. This capability is particularly valuable in improving variant calling, reducing both false positives and false negatives in sequencing data.
One of the most promising applications of AI in genomics lies in personalized medicine. AI helps match patients with personalized treatments based on their unique genetic profiles, especially in oncology and for rare diseases. This approach allows for more targeted and effective therapies, minimizing adverse effects and improving patient outcomes.
Furthermore,AI is accelerating drug discovery by speeding up target identification and biomarker development.It also optimizes CRISPR gene editing by predicting off-target effects, making gene therapies safer and more effective. In synthetic biology, AI assists in designing and engineering custom DNA sequences for biotech applications.
AI algorithms are also enhancing early disease detection by analyzing genetic predispositions, helping with proactive healthcare strategies. AI-driven tools improve newborn screening, carrier screening, and polygenic risk scoring for complex diseases.
U.S. Genomics Market: Segment Insights The U.S. genomics market is segmented by application and technology, deliverables, and end-use. Functional genomics currently holds a dominant position, driven by the rise in next-generation sequencing (NGS) and whole-genome sequencing (WGS), along with their applications in drug discovery and vaccine development. The demand for real-time PCR and other functional genomic techniques is also contributing to this segment’s growth.
The expansion of targeted therapies and pharmacogenomics is increasing the need for genomic testing, further driving segment expansion. Hospitals and diagnostic labs require a steady supply of testing kits for patient-specific treatments. Government-funded initiatives, such as the NIH’s All of Us research program, are also fueling demand and growth.
Pathway analysis is expected to grow at the fastest rate in the market during the forecast period of 2025 to 2034. Genomic pathway analysis helps identify genetic markers linked to diseases, allowing pharmaceutical companies to develop targeted therapies. Investments in genomics-based solutions drive innovation across pharmaceuticals, agritech, and synthetic biology. Proteomics tools are being deployed to research and analyse biomarkers, understand disease mechanisms, and in bioforensics.
Deliverables: Products vs. Services The product segment led the U.S. genomics market, with extensive use of instruments and techniques such as polymerase chain reactions (PCR). In 2024, the PCR sector held the largest market share, driven by its decreasing cost and high demand in hospitals, clinics, and ambulatory centers. PCR is used in the lab to create several copies of particular DNA.
The services segment is anticipated to grow with the highest CAGR during the studied years. The development of Next-Generation Sequencing (NGS) is enabling companies to outsource projects that require high-throughput and cost-effective sequencing, making large-scale genomic analysis feasible. The cost of sequencing a human genome has dropped substantially, from US$100 million in 2001 to under US$200, making it widely accessible. Lower-cost services have allowed sequencing technologies to be accessible in clinical diagnostics, precision medicine, and consumer genomics. Increasing use of sequencing for cancer genomics, rare disease diagnostics, and pharmacogenomics is driving demand. Whole-genome and whole-exome sequencing (WGS/WES) are now more common in hospitals and research institutions.
End-Use: Academic & Government Institutes Dominate The academic & government Institutes segment dominated the market. The National Institutes of Health (NIH) and other U.S. agencies provide notable funding for genomics research. Programs like the All of Us Research Program and the Cancer Genome Atlas drive large-scale genomic studies. Federal support for genomics-based precision medicine and disease research fuels institutional dominance. Universities and research centers conduct early-stage genomics research,identifying disease pathways and novel drug targets. Research centers drive innovation in next-generation sequencing (NGS), CRISPR gene editing, and single-cell genomics. Institutions like the Broad institute and Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory are leading advancements in computational genomics and synthetic biology. With strong government backing, advanced research capabilities, and extensive industry collaborations, research centers, academia, and government institutes remain the dominant force in the U.S.genomics market, driving innovation and large-scale genomic initiatives.
The hospitals & clinics segment is growing rapidly in the U.S. genomics market in 2024. Hospitals increasingly use genomics to tailor treatments based on a patient’s genetic profile, improving efficacy and reducing side effects. Pharmacogenomics helps doctors prescribe the right drugs at the right dose, reducing adverse reactions. Next-Generation Sequencing (NGS) allows oncologists to detect cancer mutations and choose targeted therapies (e.g., immunotherapies like keytruda). Hospitals are integrating liquid biopsy tests for non-invasive cancer screening and monitoring. Genomic sequencing is used to track and manage infectious diseases like COVID-19, tuberculosis, and antibiotic-resistant bacteria. Hospitals rely on microbial genomics for outbreak surveillance and infection control.U.S. healthcare policies are increasingly covering genomic testing for cancer, rare diseases, and prenatal care.
Recent Developments in the U.S. Genomics Market Several key developments highlight the dynamism of the U.S. genomics market:
In February 2025, PATHOMIQ, Inc., partnered with Myriad Genetics, Inc., granting Myriad exclusive licensing rights to PATHOMIQ’s AI technology platform for prostate cancer, PATHOMIQ_PRAD, in the US.This collaboration aims to change how physicians treat cancer patients through machine learning and AI-enabled diagnostics. Also in February 2025, 10x Genomics, Inc., unveiled new product developments at
AI: the Genomic Revolution – Unlocking personalized Medicine and Drug Discovery Is the convergence of artificial intelligence and genomics poised to revolutionize healthcare as we know it? The answer,quite simply,is a resounding yes.
Interviewer: Dr. Evelyn Reed, a leading expert in genomic medicine, welcome to World Today News. Your work focuses on the intersection of AI and genomics. Could you begin by explaining the transformative impact of AI on genomics, particularly within the U.S. market?
Dr. Reed: The request of artificial intelligence to genomics is indeed transformative. AI’s power lies in its ability to sift through the massive datasets generated by next-generation sequencing (NGS) and other high-throughput genomic technologies. this allows for pattern recognition and the identification of subtle genetic variations—mutations, polymorphisms, and epigenetic changes—which would be impractical to detect using conventional methods. the U.S. market is a leader in this field due to significant investments in research and development, coupled with a robust healthcare infrastructure. This allows for rapid translation of genomic discoveries into clinical applications.
Interviewer: You mentioned next-generation sequencing. Can you elaborate on its role in this revolution and its impact on diffrent areas of healthcare?
Dr. Reed: Next-generation sequencing (NGS) provides the foundational data that fuels the AI revolution in genomics. NGS technologies allow researchers and clinicians to rapidly sequence entire genomes or specific regions within a genome, offering a comprehensive view of an individual’s genetic makeup. This high-throughput sequencing capability is essential for applications like personalized medicine,where treatment decisions are tailored based on a patient’s genetic profile. For example, in oncology, NGS helps identify cancer-driving mutations, enabling oncologists to select targeted therapies more effectively. It’s also revolutionizing the identification of genetic markers associated with complex diseases, and improving diagnostics for rare diseases and infectious disease studies.
Interviewer: How is AI specifically enhancing personalized medicine and drug discovery? could you provide real-world examples?
Dr. Reed: AI is truly changing the landscape of both personalized medicine and drug discovery. In personalized medicine,AI algorithms analyze patient genomic data alongside clinical information to predict individual responses to various drug therapies – reducing trial and error in selecting suitable treatments.Pharmacogenomics, which predicts drug efficacy and side effects based on an individual’s genetic makeup, is one prime example. In drug discovery, AI accelerates the identification of new drug targets and allows researchers to sift through enormous chemical databases, greatly improving efficiency in identifying potential drug candidates. As a notable example,AI models are used to predict the effectiveness of drug molecules against specific gene targets before costly and time-consuming pre-clinical trials.
Interviewer: Let’s discuss the U.S. genomics market segmentation. What are the leading segments, and what are the driving forces behind their growth?
Dr. Reed: The U.S. genomics market is segmented based on various factors, including application (functional genomics, pathway analysis, etc.), technology, deliverables (products vs. services), and end-users (academic institutions, hospitals, etc.). Currently, functional genomics, with its focus on gene expression, protein function, and regulatory elements, holds a significant portion of the market, largely driven by the widespread adoption of NGS . Pathway analysis is a rapidly growing segment, with the increasing understanding of the complex interactions between genes and in their role in disease. the advancements in technology, particularly the decreasing cost of sequencing, and the growing need for personalized medicine and efficient drug development are key drivers of this market expansion.
Interviewer: what about the role of academic and goverment institutions, and how do thay contribute to the innovation within this thriving U.S. market?
Dr. Reed: Academic and government institutions play a crucial role as initiators of research and development in genomics. The National Institutes of Health (NIH) and other funding agencies substantially contribute by providing grants and funding large-scale genomic projects and studies that build the foundational knowledge base for this field. These institutions serve as a driving force in innovation through basic research, technological development, and the training of experts in the field. Their collaborations with the private sector also fosters the transition from research discoveries to real-world applications.
Interviewer: what are some key takeaways for our readers who are interested in this burgeoning field?
Dr. Reed: the convergence of AI and genomics is poised to transform healthcare. Remember these key aspects:
AI significantly increases the efficiency and accuracy of genomic data analysis.
Personalized medicine, enabled by AI and genomics, allows for more effective and targeted treatments.
AI accelerates drug discovery by shortening lead times and significantly reducing overall costs.
The U.S. market is driving innovation, attracting investment, and leading in the development of transformative technologies.
The future of medicine lies in understanding the complex interplay between our genes and our health. AI and genomics work hand-in-hand to unlock this understanding, paving the way for a healthier future. We encourage you to share your thoughts and questions in the comments below.
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->business reporting and performance

author: @ilsussidiario
title: 160 CRISTIANI UCCISI IN NIGERIA/ "Una strage dell'islam fondamentalista in un Paese nel caos"
text:
160 CRISTIANI UCCISI IN NIGERIA/ “Una strage dell’islam fondamentalista in un Paese nel caos”
In Nigeria a Natale sono stati uccisi oltre 160 cristiani in reazione a un massacro di musulmani con il quale però i cristiani non c'entrano
Una strage nei giorni di Natale, dal 23 al 26 dicembre, con oltre 160 morti, messa a segno in alcuni villaggi dello stato di Plateau: 26 comunità per la maggior parte costituite da cristiani. Una tragedia alla quale la
Nigeria non è nuova, che va inquadrata in una situazione di tensione fra musulmani e cristiani, ma che non può essere letta esclusivamente nei termini di un conflitto religioso. Si tratta, infatti, di una contrapposizione che in realtà va analizzata anche dal punto politico ed etnico.
Gli attacchi di questi giorni, spiega Massimo Introvigne, sociologo fondatore del Cesnur e del sito Bitter Winter, vanno spiegati rifacendosi a un altro gravissimo episodio che si è verificato all’inizio del mese, quando 120 musulmani sono stati uccisi durante una festa in seguito a un attacco aereo dell’aviazione nigeriana, che secondo la versione ufficiale avrebbe colpito la gente per errore nel corso di un’operazione contro i terroristi.
Le incursioni nei villaggi nei giorni di Natale da parte di gruppi armati possono essere interpretate come una reazione a questo episodio, forse ingiustamente addebitato proprio ai cristiani: segno che il
fondamentalismo islamico è ancora molto presente. Una vicenda, quella del 3 dicembre, le cui dinamiche lasciano comunque perplessi. Potrebbe essere il segnale di un tentativo di destabilizzazione del Paese che punti a riaccendere il fuoco dello scontro religioso e non solo. Chi possa essere all’origine di questo piano non è ancora chiaro: per capirlo bisognerà comprendere prima di tutto di chi sia la responsabilità dei fatti dei primi giorni di dicembre, probabile origine della scia di sangue che ha sconvolto il Natale nigeriano.
Come è possibile spiegare queste uccisioni in Nigeria? Quali sono i motivi di un piano così efferato?
Ci sono fattori tribali e fattori religiosi. È sicuramente un errore impostare la questione semplicemente sotto l’aspetto religioso. Così come è sbagliato dire che il fattore religioso non c’entra nulla. In realtà i fattori da prendere in considerazione sono tre: politico, etnico e religioso. Il fatto che comunque ogni tanto questi massacri ricomincino significa che la situazione non è esattamente sotto controllo.
In che misura incidono questi singoli elementi?
Il fattore politico incide perché la situazione nigeriana è caratterizzata da una notevole instabilità, con continue lotte fra partiti e intrapartiti. Ogni tanto sembrano risolte, come anche gli Usa parrebbero confermare, poi però le cose vanno in un’altra direzione. Il fattore etnico conta perché di solito i cristiani hanno un’appartenenza tribale diversa rispetto ai musulmani. Poi va considerato che il fondamentalismo islamico non è mai stato totalmente debellato: la Nigeria ci racconta che Boko Haram e altre organizzazioni terroristiche non ci sono più. Ma è evidente che ci sono ancora.
Gli attacchi di Natale vengono inquadrati anche come lotta tra pastori e agricoltori. Altri leggono questo conflitto con una connotazione più religiosa. Chi sono le bande che hanno agito in questi giorni?
Bisogna fare un passo indietro e andare a quello che è successo all’inizio del mese: durante una festa islamica nello stato di Kaduna, a Tudun Biri, c’è stato un attacco aereo e sono stati ammazzati 120 musulmani. Difficile credere che sia stato un incidente, come dice il governo nigeriano. Si è trattato comunque di un’azione dell’aviazione nigeriana. Le persone colpite stavano celebrando un festival religioso e non risulta che fossero terroristi. Alcuni leggono l’attacco ai cristiani di Natale, tra sabato sera e lunedì, come una reazione all’attacco aereo di inizio mese. Questo ci porta in uno scenario ancora più inquietante, perché non è impossibile che nell’esercito nigeriano ci siano personaggi o correnti che per rovesciare l’attuale governo peschino nel torbido. È abbastanza chiaro che un attacco aereo nei confronti di un gruppo di musulmani avrebbe portato a una reazione opposta di estremisti che dietro a questo episodio, secondo me del tutto a torto, vedono i cristiani. Anche gli specialisti di cose nigeriane non sono sorpresi che ci sia stata una reazione, arrivata a Natale per ragioni simboliche. Questo conferma che i fondamentalisti islamici ci sono, che l’etnia Fulani, che ce l’ha con i cristiani, ha ancora delle milizie armate fino ai denti. Ma è anche vero che questo specifico attacco risponde a quello del 3 dicembre.
Gli Stati Uniti che ruolo hanno in questa situazione?
Hanno sempre supportato la repressione di Boko Haram, anche perché lo considerano legato all’Isis. Sembrerebbe di capire però che non sia verissimo che il terrorismo sia stato debellato. I fatti di questi giorni ci raccontano due cose: che i terroristi ci sono e che sono stati provocati ad arte dal cosiddetto incidente delle bombe sganciate sui musulmani. Era un po’ che non erano protagonisti di azione spettacolari. Quindi si tratta di capire chi ha organizzato la provocazione del 3 dicembre.
I cristiani che ruolo hanno nel Paese e come vivono in questo contesto?
Hanno un ruolo importante nella politica, sono abbastanza numerosi da essere decisivi per il voto. Ogni tanto si difendono anche in armi, in genere però sono meno inclini ad organizzare milizie e mettere le cose su un piano militare. Se si tratta di farsi la guerra a colpi di attentati terroristici c’è tutta una rete internazionale, dall’Isis ad Al Qaeda, che può supportare formazioni musulmane, mentre non esiste niente di simile per i cristiani.
Ma le persecuzioni contro i cristiani prima della tragedia dello stato di Plateau si erano ridotte?
Gli atti di discriminazione dei cristiani e di piccola persecuzione quotidiana non sono mai finiti, ma
gli attentati spettacolari erano un po’ scemati, gli ultimi sono stati un anno fa. Poi sono arrivate notizie di scontri nei villaggi, di assassini: non è che fosse finita. Ma attacchi su questa scala non se n’erano visti. Anche se poi ci sono gruppi che ci dicono che comunque il numero di cristiani uccisi anche in imboscate tese a dieci, venti persone, è nell’ordine dei 3mila quest’anno.
Ma alla fine in questo tipo di conflitto quali aspetti prevalgono?
C’è chi dice che i conflitti esclusivamente religiosi non esistano, perché tutti poi hanno motivazioni politiche, etniche o economiche. Se prendiamo il conflitto più noto, quello fra Israele e Palestina, vediamo che non è unicamente religioso, però il fattore religioso esiste e tutta una serie di comportamenti non si spiegano senza prenderlo in considerazione. Diciamo che i fattori religiosi vanno considerati insieme ad altri.
(Paolo Rossetti)
— — — —
Abbiamo bisogno del tuo contributo per continuare a fornirti una informazione di qualità e indipendente.
SOSTIENICI. DONA ORA CLICCANDO QUI
© RIPRODUZIONE RISERVATA

author: Toponotomalasuerte
title: #57 Un atentado islamista durante la misa de Navidad deja más de 160 cristianos asesinados en Nigeria
text:
Portada
mis comunidades
otras secciones
[#0](c0#c-0) Ese titular es tendencioso y confuso, y probablemente seas consciente. El ataque no fue durante una misa, como quiere dar a entender, si no que se atacó una serie de aldeas de manera coordinada. Y además, el factor religioso no es el único relevante, y tampoco está plenamente confirmado.
Hay fuentes mucho más serias, informadas y rigurosas que la que has mandado...
[#10](c10#c-10) Resulta difícil creer que puedan existir fuentes más serias leyendo maravillas cosas como:
La reciente matanza sucedida en Navidad confirma lo que anuncian las estadísticas: el cristianismo es la religión más perseguida en el mundo. Y no se limita solamente a esta región de África, sino que ocurre en Asia y Medio Oriente. Hace poco a cristianos perseguidos por el régimen comunista chino se les negó asilo en la España de Pedro Sánchez y el PSOE. Solo una lo pudo obtener porque su salud le impedía subir al avión donde la deportaban.
Todo ello, mientras las pateras siguen llegando a España, posiblemente con insurgentes tan radicales como los que masacran a los cristianos en Nigeria y sin el amparo para los cristianos que huyen de estos.
Mira, igual en que en Gaza, pero estos no lo llaman masacre.
https://www.lavanguardia.com/internacional/20231217/9456963/iglesia-denuncia-israel-mato-sangre-fria-dos-feligresas-gaza.html
https://es.zenit.org/2023/12/12/22-cristianos-muertos-en-gaza-cohete-sin-detonar-hallado-en-parroquia/
[#9](c9#c-9) bueno. Entérate quién financio al valeroso pueblo de Afganistán y sus valerosos guerreros los muyahidines( les dedicaron Rambo iii y todo), o quien armó y financio a Irak, a estos que ves ahora este terrible atentado de la noticia, quien los organizo y financió, ... Después nos vuelves a contar estás cosas. Y si sigues pensando que está irán detrás de todo pq es omnipresente vale. Si ves q algún otro estado puede estar implicado, fijate quién lo arma y financia. Un saludo.
[#13](c13#c-13) lo se y lo he criticado 100 millones de veces, dinero de EEUU y Arabia Saudita y Pakistán.
Pero eso no les importa para llamarlos partisanos, "que en Europa les habría llamado partisanos y que habrían luchado contra los nazis"
Eso es mierda, el fanatismo religioso no atiende a razones.
Al menos tu comentario muestra algo de vergüenza de esa gente... Algo es algo.
[#20](c20#c-20) pues mira otra vez la captura que mandas, pq es exactamente lo que estoy diciendo. Afganistán era un país más adelantado que España y las mujeres iban sin velo. El tío Sam puso a la derecha religiosa conservadora, o lo que viene a ser los fascistas de toda la vida, pero en musulmán, a levantarse en armas... Cómo en Irak, libia, Egipto, Ucrania... Mismo proceder en todos lados, mismo resultado en todos lados. Países de mierda con gobiernos autoritarios y la población paupérrima y reprimida. Eso es el tío Sam.
[#30](c30#c-30) Claro, Afganistan era un paraiso...
https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guerra_de_Afganist%C3%A1n_(1978-1992)
Tienes una vision de la historia bastante distorsionada. China tambien dio armas a los talibanes para luchar contra la URSS, entre otros tantos paises....
Claaaaaaro, todo culpa del tio sam...
[#31](c31#c-31) entérate lo que era Afganistán antes del 92.
Era un estado laico. En el año 90 la mayoría del profesorado eran mujeres, por ejemplo, que estaba integrada en el mundo laboral.
Y la revolución hostigada por el tío Sam puso a los integristas islámicos. Los valerosos muyahidines, como dijeron en Rambo 3, que les dedicaron.
Infórmate tú un poquito, antes de hablar sin saber.
[#32](c32#c-32) tengo entendido dos cosas : Rambo III estaba dedicada a “the galant people of Afghanistan” , lo otro es un bulo . Pero la info en internet se contradice en todas partes acerca de esto , asi que no sé.
Segundo:
Lo de que Afghanistan era laico , mujeres sin velo etc . se ha mostrado erróneo, solo era en Khabul . En las zonas agrarias (el resto del país) era anticuado respecto a esto .
Pero es un lío y al final no sabes lo que es verdad o no , internet está lleno de información contradictoria .
[#13](c13#c-13) Se financian infinitud de proyectos e ideologías en los 5 continentes, para bien y para mal, y solo los “amigos de las cabras” son los que a posteriori se dedican al terrorismo.
[#56](c56#c-56) con lo de los amigos de las cabras supongo q te refieres a los valerosos guerreros muyahidines, que junto a los USA liberaron del yugo comunista a Afganistán y lo convirtieron en la tierra de libertades que es hoy. No? O te refieres a las primaveras árabes? O a liberar libia? Iraq? El maidan de Ucrania?

Hoy te estás coronado máquina.
Que lastima que estes aquí criticando a occidente para tapar mierdas de asesinos fanatizados y no allí al revés como los verdaderos mártires que si luchan por denunciar atrocidades de países islámicos, ahí veríamos lo valiente que eres con tu reinvidicacion de sofa y tu bandera nazi con la israelí en la foto de perfil.

yo no financie a nadie, manipulador de pacotilla. Típico de esos de la bandera de tu perfil.
Muestras muchos decíamos que la primavera árabe está plagado de fanáticos religiosos que apoyaban las reveliones, tantos otros decían que "callate, hacen lo que deberíamos estar haciendo en Europa, es una revolución". Ahora a gente como tú, si tu, que estás criticando a los críticos con el yihadismo de hamas se le avisa que apoyar grupos terroristas que hacen matanzas públicas es una barbaridad y que esto les embalentona y atrae a más fanáticos y que será la perdición de Palestina no escucháis. Dentro de 10 años saldrán muchos de Europa que han visto gritos de Allahu adbak y tontos en Internet diciendo que el único error de hamas es no haber actuado antes... Luego habrán chavales que pensarán que están siendo héroes en un Isis o unos talibanes dando su vida por puercos que vienen a cuerpo de rey con 4 mujeres y esclavas sexuales.
[#18](c18#c-18) para tí seguro que extrema derecha es alguien de izquierdas que no compre el pack correntista de turno.
Estos son los que en Francia, España e Italia eran llamados partisanos por que no se que mierdas de las circunstancias? O estos los podemos llamar terroristas?
La yihad se lleva a cabo con muerte de infieles y el miedo a serlo.
No se trata de liberar nada, cada ataque sirve para atraer radicales y causar estragos en los no creyetes.
Quien apoya a yihadistas es tan asesino como ellos.
[#3](c3#c-3) Estos son los que llevan EEUU y UK financiando más de un siglo

Aquí cuando iban a la casa blanca a recibir paguitas
https://es.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Archivo:Reagan_sitting_with_people_from_the_Afghanistan-Pakistan_region_in_February_1983.jpg

Vuestra fijación por defender o tapar cada asesino terrorista con escusas es repugnante y os rebaja como... Voy a decir seres humanos.
Es decir para vosotros el fanatismo islámico viene de un supuesto apoyo de EEUU a hamas y no de irán...
Boko haram es un paso de baile radicalizado por EEUU.
Los talibanes son partisanos radicalizados por EEUU.
Los hermanos musulmanes se radicalizado jugando call of duty.
Pero jamás lobbys, poderes y dinero de países radicales apoyan a estos grupos de mierda.
Así es vuestro mundo.
[#9](c9#c-9) ¿En qué parte de su comentario dice eso? "no son culpables de sus actos" y toda la mierda que sigue. O qué parte de su comentario te ha llevado a esa conclusión, si es que necesitas algo más de margen.
Aunque es posible que esa respuesta no tenga nada que ver con su comentario y simplemente sea una patética y lamentable pataleta porque no te ha gustado su respuesta.
[#17](c17#c-17) "por no sé que historia".
¿O por "no quiero saber"? Te dan la oportunidad de aprender, no la desperdicies.
[#19](c19#c-19) tienes algún comentario de crítica o de repudio a esta atrocidad? O vienes aquí a adoctrinar me sobre lo malo que es eeuu?
Es una noticia de 160 muertos a manos de yihadistas por ser infieles.
Entre tu y yo? Es duro entrar aquí a un noticia tan trágica y ponerte a discutir sobre si la culpa es o no es de occidente o ya estás curado de eso?
Entras aquí a recalcar que "no quiero saber" tu verdad... Que ascazo.
[#21](c21#c-21) Eres tú quien ha introducido este tema. Igual esperabas otro tipo de respuestas y ahora te arrepientes de haberte puesto a chapotear con intención de salpicar a los demás.
[#23](c23#c-23) en todo momento denunció:
1* las atrocidades de grupos islamistas radicales, no como tantos aquí que aprendieron que eran los talibanes hace 2 meses y ahora los llaman partisanos. Asesinos es su nombre, como es el del gobierno de irán o Arabia Saudita ente otros.
2* crítico a los que claramente ocultan y defienden a estos asesinos bajo un pretexto de victimismo en Palestina.
Un terrorista es un terrorista y lo es con 0 muertos en Palestina y con un millón de muertos.

¿Crees de verdad que si a esta gente nadie estuviera tocándole los huevos en su casa harían lo mismo?
Ir a la raíz del problema, a las causas, e intentar desenredar un tema complejo no es defender a nadie.
[#12](c12#c-12) pero si tu pecas de lo mismo.
A quien coño quieres dar lecciones?
EEUU: apoyo yihadistas para quitarse de en medio a un enemigo común.
Tu: apoyas yihadistas para quitarte de en medio un enemigo común.
Eso que tienes ahí llamando nazis es la bandera de Israel no? Imagino que no eres simpatizante, pues eso.
La única deferencia entre EEUU y vosotros es que a EEUU sólo le movía la política, a vosotros os pierde el fanatismo.
Sabes lo que más me revienta de vosotros? Que no vais a ser vosotros quien caiga en esa oscuridad por vuestra culpa.
Habrá niños de 15 que se sentirán libertadores, partisanos, defensores poniendo bombas para un estado islámico por vuestra culpa y vuestros comentarios.
[#8](c8#c-8) Reagan murió hace 20 años y dejó la presidencia hace 35... De verdad tu argumento más solido es usar una foto de hace 40 años? Alguna prueba que adjuntar a la afirmación de la financiación de EEUU y UK a los culpables de este atentado?

author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: WBB: Ellis Scores Career High 21 Points In Loss To UIW
text:
WBB: Ellis Scores Career High 21 Points In Loss To UIW
McNeese women's basketball faced off against Incarnate Word, suffering a 77-63 defeat despite Kiayra Ellis' career-high 21 points. The game featured 14 ties and 10 lead changes, with McNeese initially leading 52-49 entering the fourth quarter. UIW launched a decisive 15-0 run, outscoring McNeese 28-11 in the last quarter to secure their victory. The loss leaves McNeese with an overall record of 8-13 and 3-7 in conference play, while UIW improves to 12-8 and 7-4.
- McNeese shot 42.6% from the field while UIW shot 42.3%.
- UIW scored 50 of their 77 points in the paint and capitalized on 10 Cowgirl turnovers for 24 points.
Despite a solid shooting performance, McNeese's inability to maintain their lead in the final quarter showcased their struggle to perform consistently throughout the game. UIW's advantage in scoring off turnovers also highlighted McNeese’s defensive vulnerabilities.
State of Play- McNeese is currently ranked 3-7 in conference play and 8-13 overall.
- Ellis has now scored in double figures in multiple games, signaling her growth as a key player.
McNeese is set to visit Nicholls on Saturday, February 1, aiming to rebound from the loss against UIW and improve their conference standing.
Bottom LineMcNeese must leverage its strong individual performances into cohesive teamwork, particularly in crunch time, to enhance their competitiveness in upcoming games.
Read more at McNeese State University Athletics
The summary of the linked article was generated with the assistance of artificial intelligence technology from OpenAI

title: Temperatures to drop in Armenia from Sunday - Panorama | Armenian news
text: Temperatures to drop in Armenia from Sunday Clear weather is expected in Armenia on Friday, Saturday and later next week. Rain and snow are forecast for some parts of the country on Sunday and Monday. Temperatures are set to fall by up to 11C starting from Sunday. The capital Yerevan could see showers late on Sunday and Monday. author: @https://www.twitter.com/CRY_UK
title: Running MCR Half!!
text: Me and my mum had both never ran more than 5km before and we were up for a challenge in 2024 and after the loss of my friend Mia we decided to sign up for the Manchester Half Marathon in memory of Mia Jennings. In order to prepare for the half marathon we managed to do a lot of training both in the gym and outside doing various distances. We were both very nervous to run and when it came to race day it was very emotional too. With both me and my mum training hard we managed to complete the half marathon and we managed to raise over £300. And I have managed to find myself running at every opportunity and I’ve since signed up for a few more running events. Thank you so much to everyone that supported us!!
